'''Menel''' was an [[Elvish]] (both [[Quenya]] and [[Sindarin]]) name for the regions of [[vilya (word)|air]] above [[ambar#Ambar|Ambar]], a name which is generally meant as "firmament, heaven" or "the heavens".<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, ''menel''</ref> Sometimes the word is simply synonymous with [[ilmen|the sky]], but in other uses it is meant as a more sublime reference to the domain of the [[stars]] and heavenly bodies. 

Menel is a physical place within [[Arda]], although arguably a sacred one as it is the location of the [[stars]] of [[Elbereth]].
==Etymology==
The word is understood as ''[[men (Elvish)|men]]'' "towards" + ''[[el]]'' "star" meaning "the Direction of the Stars".<ref name="RGEO">{{RGEO|7}}, p. 72</ref>

The loremaster [[Quennar]] is attributed as having devised the word ''Menel'' ("heavens, firmament").<ref>{{PE|21}}, p. 84</ref><ref group=note>However in other cases Tolkien wrote that menel derives from [[Primitive Elvish]], as it is found both in Sindarin and Adûnaic. See [[#Derivatives]].</ref>

While writing ''[[Átaremma]]'', Tolkien used ''menel'' to translate "Heaven", but in the final forms he preferred ''ëa han ëa'' "beyond [[Ea|Creation]]"; distinguishing thus ''menel'' (heaven, as the physical sky) from the metaphysical Heaven.<ref>{{webcite|articlename=Átaremma i ëa han Eä “our Father who art in Heaven” |website=Eldamo|accessed=21-7-2023|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-760645523.html}}</ref>

==Examples==
Menel is seen in numerous personal and place-names, including [[Meneltarma]] (the "Pillar of Heaven"), [[Meneldil]], [[Tar-Meneldur]], [[Armenelos]] and [[Meneldor]].  

It also appears in ''[[A Elbereth Gilthoniel]]'' "''o menel [[aglar]] [[elen]][[-ath|ath]]''" ("from the glories of the star-host of heaven").<ref>{{FR|Meetings}}</ref>

[[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] used it in his invocation from [[Cirith Ungol]]: "''o menel [[palan]]-[[tir|diriel]]''" ("from heaven gazing afar").<ref>{{TT|IV10}}</ref>

==Derivatives==
It already existed in [[Avarin]], and survived as such in [[Adûnaic]] ''minal''.<ref>{{SD|3vi}} p.414</ref>
